Comment: That's actually not what Catholics do. At age 14-15 their kids start confirmation classes where they learn the history of the church including all the schisms, the actual dogma of Catholicism like transubstantiation and the sanctity of life, and then those kids are asked to make a free and informed choice about whether they want to be confirmed Catholic. That's better than just about any protestant denomination I can think of. American Catholics are uniquely defiant of the Pope and many Catholic doctrines, especially the converts.
